column4: oh, and profanephobia: Can I get an applet to allow me to have an icon in my system tray for my wireless connection (signal strength, etc)
on /etc/modprobed.d/aliases
do you have ipv6 enabled? that slows down the dns lookup
Think so. Where can I disable it?
Just comment out the ipv6 entry?
alias net-pf-10 off
I just disabled ipv6 by putting in those two off lines in my aliases file and now I can't connect or resolve at all!
do a  /etc/init.d/networking restart
'No DCHPOFFERS received. No working leases in presistent database - sleeping'
you can manually enable your nic card and run dhclient
It's lost my AP again.
It seems that my wireless card has suddenly lost signal and I can't connect.
how far is it?

When it was running Windows, it could sit right where it is now and get an almost perfect signal. It's definitely within range, because this computer is sitting right beside it and getting a good signal.
What do you suggest?
sometimes the signal strength is also too strong and saturates your receiver..
look into the driver capabilities if anything you can trim the sensitivity or whatever
also wireless stuff does not guarantee that connectivity 100%
I want connectivity to be at least as good as it was on Windows, which was 95%.
not too much to ask..make sure you dont have lots of metals between your nic and AP
you need to start responding with a prefixed of my nick, or else it will be missed
Yeah, no worries.
